username.description: Login username (Student ID or Employee ID)

password_reset_tokens.description: Password reset tokens for account recovery

user_roles.description: Many-to-many relationship between users and roles

role_permissions.description: Many-to-many relationship between roles and permissions

subject_majors.description: Many-to-many relationship between subjects and majors

indexes.name: idx_classes_subject_semester_code
indexes.description: Unique constraint for class within subject and semester

indexes.name: idx_classes_semester_id
indexes.description: For queries: all classes in a semester

indexes.name: idx_classes_subject_id
indexes.description: For queries: all classes of a subject

is_enrolled.description: Enrollment status. When false, student is withdrawn from the class but historical attendance is preserved.

indexes.name: idx_enrollments_class_id_enrolled
indexes.description: For roster queries (enrolled students only)

indexes.name: idx_enrollments_student_user_id
indexes.description: For student's enrolled classes queries

notes: is_enrolled is NOT a soft delete flag. It represents enrollment/withdrawal status.
is_enrolled = true: Student is actively enrolled and appears in roster
is_enrolled = false: Student has withdrawn but historical attendance is preserved
To query active roster: WHERE is_enrolled = true
To query all enrollments (including withdrawn): No filter needed
Difference from soft delete: Withdrawn students can be re-enrolled by setting is_enrolled = true
When is_enrolled = false, student is withdrawn and hidden from roster but historical attendance is preserved (see BR-33)

student_profiles.description: Extended profile information for student users

roll_number.description: Student's unique roll number: two uppercase letters + 6 digits (e.g., HE180314, HS181259, BE170843)

base_photo_url.description: URL/path to the student's base photo (avatar) file, used for visual comparison during attendance verification.

staff_profiles.description: Extended profile information for staff users (lecturers, supervisors, etc.)

cameras.description: IP cameras installed in rooms for attendance monitoring

rtsp_url.description: RTSP stream URL for video access

class_id.description: Reference to class. This is NULL for independent final exam slots (slot_category = 'FINAL_EXAM').

semester_id.description: Reference to semester. Required for all slots. Must be provided when creating any slot. For LECTURE/LECTURE_WITH_PT slots, this must match the semester of the specified class. For FINAL_EXAM slots (where class_id is NULL), this is the only link to a semester.

staff_user_id.description: Lecturer or supervisor responsible for the slot

slot_category.description: Category of slot: 'LECTURE' (regular lecture), 'LECTURE_WITH_PT' (lecture with progress test), or 'FINAL_EXAM' (final exam)

title.description: The specific name of the slot, especially for an exam (e.g., 'Progress Test 1').

description.description: General notes or instructions for the slot, visible to participants.

session_status.description: Regular attendance session status: NOT_STARTED, RUNNING, STOPPED. Used for LECTURE and LECTURE_WITH_PT slots to track regular lecture attendance.

scan_count.description: Number of regular attendance scans performed. Increments on each session start.

last_session_stopped_at.description: Timestamp when regular attendance session was last stopped. NULL if never stopped.

exam_session_status.description: Exam attendance session status: NOT_STARTED, RUNNING, STOPPED. Used for LECTURE_WITH_PT (progress tests) and FINAL_EXAM slots to track exam attendance independently from regular attendance.

exam_scan_count.description: Number of exam scans performed. Increments on each exam session start. Tracks progress test and final exam scans separately from regular attendance.

last_exam_session_stopped_at.description: Timestamp when exam session was last stopped. NULL if never stopped. Used for both progress tests and final exams.

indexes.name: idx_slots_class_id
indexes.description: For queries: get all slots for a class

indexes.name: idx_slots_semester_id
indexes.description: For queries: get all slots in a semester, especially for independent exam slots.

indexes.name: idx_slots_staff_user_id
indexes.description: For lecturer schedule queries

indexes.name: idx_slots_room_id
indexes.description: For room utilization queries

indexes.name: idx_slots_start_time
indexes.description: For date range queries and schedule display

notes: slot_category determines slot behavior and available functions.
LECTURE/LECTURE_WITH_PT slots must have a non-null class_id.
FINAL_EXAM slots must have a null class_id and a non-null semester_id.
Lecturers can update slot_category between LECTURE and LECTURE_WITH_PT.
Cannot change to/from FINAL_EXAM (only DOP can manage).
DUAL SESSION MANAGEMENT: Slots support two independent attendance sessions (regular and exam) with separate status tracking.
LECTURE slots: Use only regular session fields (session_status, scan_count, last_session_stopped_at).
LECTURE_WITH_PT slots: Use BOTH regular and exam session fields independently to track lecture attendance and progress test attendance separately.
FINAL_EXAM slots: Use only exam session fields (exam_session_status, exam_scan_count, last_exam_session_stopped_at).
Regular and exam sessions can be started, stopped, and rescanned independently without affecting each other.

attendance_records.description: Individual student attendance records for slots

indexes.name: idx_attendance_records_student_slot
indexes.description: One attendance record per student per slot (also serves as query index)

indexes.name: idx_attendance_records_slot_id
indexes.description: For queries: get all attendance records for a slot

indexes.name: idx_attendance_records_status
indexes.description: For filtering by status (e.g., count not_yet students)

notes: Status 'not_yet' is initial state before any attendance check
Status 'present' indicates student was detected/marked present
Status 'absent' is final absent status
Method 'auto' for face recognition results
Method 'manual' for lecturer/supervisor manual updates
Method 'system_finalize' for batch status updates during finalization

regular_attendance_remarks.description: Additional comments/notes on regular attendance records (LECTURE slots)

created_by_user_id.description: Staff member who created the remark

indexes.name: idx_regular_attendance_remarks_record_id
indexes.description: For querying all remarks for a specific attendance record

indexes.name: idx_regular_attendance_remarks_created_by
indexes.description: For querying remarks created by a specific staff member

indexes.name: idx_regular_attendance_remarks_created_at
indexes.description: For chronological queries

notes: Used for explaining attendance status changes or special circumstances for regular lecture attendance.
Multiple remarks can be added to the same attendance record.
Remarks are required when manually changing attendance status.
CASCADE delete ensures remarks are removed when attendance record is deleted.

regular_attendance_evidences.description: Stores temporary evidence images for REGULAR attendance records (from 'attendance_records' table).

attendance_record_id.description: Reference to the regular attendance record this image provides evidence for.

image_url.description: URL/path to the stored evidence image file

created_at.description: Timestamp when the evidence was captured

notes: This table stores temporary data for LECTURE and LECTURE_WITH_PT slots.
A scheduled job should periodically clean up old records from this table.

exam_attendance_evidences.description: Stores temporary evidence images for EXAM attendance records (from 'exam_attendance' table).

exam_attendance_id.description: Reference to the exam attendance record this image provides evidence for.

image_url.description: URL/path to the stored evidence image file

created_at.description: Timestamp when the evidence was captured

notes: This table stores temporary data for LECTURE_WITH_PT and FINAL_EXAM slots.
A scheduled job should periodically clean up old records from this table.

exam_attendance.description: Attendance records for exam component of slots (progress tests and final exams)

recorded_at.description: When exam attendance status was recorded

indexes.name: idx_exam_attendance_student_slot
indexes.description: One exam attendance record per student per slot

indexes.name: idx_exam_attendance_slot_id
indexes.description: For queries: get all exam attendance records for a slot

indexes.name: idx_exam_attendance_status
indexes.description: For filtering by status

notes: Used for tracking attendance during exam component of slots
For LECTURE_WITH_PT slots: Both attendance_records and exam_attendance exist
For FINAL_EXAM slots: Only exam_attendance exists (no regular attendance_records)
Status 'not_yet' is initial state before any attendance check
Status 'present' indicates student was detected/marked present during exam
Status 'absent' is final absent status for exam
Method 'auto' for face recognition results
Method 'manual' for lecturer/supervisor manual updates
Method 'system_finalize' for batch status updates during finalization

exam_slot_subjects.description: Stores the list of subjects allowed to be tested in a specific FINAL_EXAM slot. This is step 1 in the student assignment workflow. Supports soft delete to prevent data loss.

id.description: Unique identifier for the slot-subject pair

subject_id.description: Reference to the subject being tested in this slot

created_at.description: Timestamp when the subject was added to the slot

is_active.description: Soft delete flag - false means logically deleted but data preserved for audit

deactivated_at.description: Timestamp when subject was removed from exam slot

deactivated_by_user_id.description: User ID who removed the subject (for audit trail)

indexes.name: idx_exam_slot_subjects_slot_subject
indexes.description: Ensures a subject can only be added once to a slot (allows re-adding after soft delete)

indexes.name: idx_exam_slot_subjects_slot_id
indexes.description: For fast queries of subjects within a slot

indexes.name: idx_exam_slot_subjects_active
indexes.description: Partial index for performance when filtering active records

notes: This table is only used when slots.slot_category = 'FINAL_EXAM'.
Data Operator must define these records BEFORE adding students.
Soft delete (is_active=false) is used instead of hard delete to preserve audit trail and prevent accidental data loss.
When a subject is removed from a slot, is_active is set to false, deactivated_at is set to current timestamp, and deactivated_by_user_id tracks who performed the action.
All queries should filter by is_active = true to only show active assignments.

exam_slot_participants.description: Manages the assignment of students to a specific SUBJECT within a FINAL_EXAM slot. This is step 2, after subjects have been assigned to the slot via the 'exam_slot_subjects' table.

id.description: Unique identifier for the student's exam participation

exam_slot_subject_id.description: Reference to the (slot + subject) pair that this student is assigned to

student_user_id.description: Reference to the student taking the exam

is_enrolled.description: Participation status. If false, the student is withdrawn from this exam.

indexes.name: idx_exam_participants_slot_subject_student
indexes.description: Ensures a student can only take a subject once per slot

indexes.name: idx_exam_participants_student_user_id
indexes.description: For querying all final exams a student is participating in

notes: This table is only used for FINAL_EXAM slots.
Student assignment must follow business logic (e.g., student must be enrolled in that subject during the semester).

exam_attendance_remarks.description: Additional comments/notes on exam attendance records (LECTURE_WITH_PT and FINAL_EXAM slots)

created_by_user_id.description: Staff member who created the remark

indexes.name: idx_exam_attendance_remarks_exam_id
indexes.description: For querying all remarks for a specific exam attendance record

indexes.name: idx_exam_attendance_remarks_created_by
indexes.description: For querying remarks created by a specific staff member

indexes.name: idx_exam_attendance_remarks_created_at
indexes.description: For chronological queries

notes: Used for explaining exam attendance status changes or special circumstances.
Multiple remarks can be added to the same exam attendance record.
Remarks are required when manually changing exam attendance status.
CASCADE delete ensures remarks are removed when exam attendance record is deleted.

face_embeddings.description: Vector embeddings generated from approved face videos for recognition

is_active.description: Whether this embedding is currently used for recognition

indexes.name: idx_face_embeddings_student_active
indexes.description: Ensure only one active embedding per student

indexes.name: idx_face_embeddings_vector
indexes.description: For fast vector similarity search using IVFFlat algorithm. Parameter 'lists' should be adjusted based on data size: lists  sqrt(total_rows). Current value (100) is suitable for ~10,000 students.

notes: Requires pgvector extension for vector operations
Only one embedding per student can be active at a time (enforced by unique index)
Version is incremented with each identity update (see BR-32)
Keep last 3 versions for audit and rollback purposes
Vector similarity search is used for face recognition
IVFFlat index performance tuning: Adjust 'lists' parameter as data grows. Rule of thumb: lists = sqrt(total_active_embeddings). Monitor query performance and rebuild index if needed.

indexes.name: idx_system_notifications_type
indexes.description: For filtering by notification type

Delivered to specific users via notification_deliveries table

notification_deliveries.description: Delivery records for system notifications to specific users

read_at.description: When user read the notification (null if unread)

recipient_user_id.description: User who should receive this notification

indexes.name: idx_notification_deliveries_recipient_unread

indexes.name: idx_notification_deliveries_recipient_created

Used to show unread counts and notification history
